data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Touch Activated Dimmer Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Touch Activated Dimmer Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Touch Activated Dimmer Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Touch Activated Dimmer Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Looks great and works well. These look awesome and work well. I only bought this one on amazon as I could find the other matching items (cover plates, outlets,etc) cheaper in other stores online.
1#Beautiful switch. Legrand moto for Adorne Collection is "it's time for a beautiful switch ". It truly is beautiful.
2#Perfect. The best switches on the market! Dimmer works great with 5 recessed leds.
3#Didnt work. Didnt work, and too late to return.
4#These work as advertised, but you MUST HAVE THREE ... These work as advertised, but you MUST HAVE THREE WIRES. If you are in an older building/home and DO NOT have three wires in the wall, you should consider the Adorne dimmer with the manual dimming control ( ADPD453LW2) for LED bulbs. Note I understand the ADPD453LW2 will dim LED bulbs, but not LED fixtures with transformers, which I am told require three wires to be dimmed.
5#Five Stars. Looks great, easy to install and works as expected.
6#Adorne collection is the way to go!! Our newly renovated kitchen was upgraded with all Adorne electrical outlets and light switches and dimmers. The sofTap Dimmer switch matches perfectly with other Adorne parts. The contractor electrician was impressed with the build quality and ease of installation. All in all, we put in a total of 6 outlets, 1 GFCI outlet, 1 Pop-Out outlet, 1 USB outlet, 1 Sensa-dimmer switch, 1 toggle dimmer switch, 2 toggle light switches, 1 Push switch, and 1 sofTap Dimmer switch. Everyone who visited were impressed with the modern accent look.
7#love the tap and it fades out to black. Clean dimming, works with TCP LED lamps, love the tap and it fades out to black, not just snap off. Very clean look, nicer than your average dimmer.
8#Four Stars. Good looking. does the job
9#These are classy dimmers that are easy to install. These are classy dimmers that are easy to install. They give a much more modern feel, and they are competitively priced, too.
10#Five Stars. Great quality dimmer for LED lighting
11#Five Stars. The best one's I found to work the my 15W Recessed Panel Light
12#The new Le Grand product line is not backward compatible ... The new Le Grand product line is not backward compatible. I wanted to replace a burned dimmer that I installed 10 years ago and found out that the new Le Grand dimmers are different in size and don't match the frame. The dimmer doesn't work, al though I'm not sure if it was malfunction when I got it or if it was burned when I connected it. All and all, I'm currently stuck without a solution but to replace the entire Le grand switches in the shared frame to a different company's switches.
13#nice product; looks cool. pretty to look at but I was not impressed that I had to also purchase the wall plate cover.
14#Great switch, but careful using with LED lights. Love the switch, but doesn't cure the buzzing heard with LED lights. I've tried several brands of dimmable LED bulbs and switches. This switch was the best out of all of them, but still wish the noise was gone.
15#GREAT product.....Caveat - plan FIRST. Unless you are installing this in a Single Gang {one switch position} Box, you need to make sure that the other switch function is available. For instance a two gang box with another switch is okay if that is a one or three way switch. If your house is like mine and open plan room and 4 way switch {more common than many think} the 4 way is hard to find. Make sure to obtain everything you need before starting the project. - Another caveat. Unlike most older dimmers, you need to wire in 'Neutral' to the dimmer. It is not always available in any given box that has a three way. _____________________________________ Recent remodel, opened up a 20 year old kitchen/ dinette / dining room to one long room. Installed LED BR30 in 11 cans for total lighting load of 150 watts which is the LED limit of most cheap dimmers. This necessitated a hi-load dimmer OR split the strings to 2 circuits each with a dimmer. When I happened on this at Lowes and saw it could easily handle the load, thought 'why not' Unfortunately what I thought was a 3 way sharing the box was 4 way. Now the 4 way is on back order and I had to kludge to continue use the old 4 way. Now for the good news, the dimmer handles the 150 watt load great, barely getting warm to the to touch, the action is smooth and the double tap for full on is fine. Again.. make SURE you have a neutral available in that box.
16#Awesome enhancement to patio lighting. This thing is sweet! I have it connected to patio lighting. The 30-second fade feature is a bit funky (slow fade to about 50% power then a sudden shut-off), but it is still very cool. While the first post-install setup felt like too many steps, those steps are fairly intuitive. Once set up, operation is very simple. Now I have bright light when I need it and mood lighting when I want it. Sweet.
17#Excellent Home Upgrade. I am not a handyman and have never done any electrical work prior to installing this dimmer, so my review is based on what I experienced during the installation. I've been using this for 3 months now. Though the Adorne styling was a little strange at first (since 99% of light switches are different from this one), it's really grown on me and many guests have asked for details on where to get them. Pros: - Looks fantastic - Good quality construction. Though most everything is plastic, it has a solid feel with good fit and finish. - Very functional (returns to previous dimmed level if you turn the light on) - Night light allows the switch to be seen in the dark - Works very well with LED bulbs (I used dimmable Philips BR30 2700k LED bulbs) with no flickering - Self-calibrating feature at the end of setup works very well - Works in standard or 3-way configuration without extra hardware - Includes all necessary pieces (even wire nuts, which I hadn't considered), but you might need a wire stripper - Easy to install. I know another user had trouble, but I followed the detailed instructions included with the bulb and felt like a professional when it was complete in 15 minutes. The only thing I'd say with this is to make sure you have the in-wall piece oriented correctly, because it's hard to read the labels on the wire terminals with no overhead lights and the box is fairly symmetrical. Cons - A little pricey - Will not well with non-dimmable bulbs, based on reviews from other sites. This should be obvious, but I struggled to find something to be unhappy about.
18#it requires special plates and is not easy! THIS DIMMER TAKES A LOT OF WORK, It is not just a replacement for standard switch or dimmer; it requires special plates and is not easy!
